## TA Training 

Duke Statistical Science, Spring 2024

Created, developed and facilitated Duke's first workshops to help prepare teaching assistants in the following areas of teaching: using active learning, Quarto, grading & giving student feedback; and GitHub. Workshops were 1.5 hours and conducted via Zoom.

Workshop 1 - Quarto: [Slides](https://elijahmeyer3.github.io/199-training/workshop1/quarto/quarto-slides.html#/title-slide); [Activity](https://github.com/ElijahMeyer3/quarto-training-exercises)

## Excellence in Teaching Symposium

Montana State University, Fall 2017 and Spring 2018

Redesigned and led year-long teaching program for new graduate students. Organized and executed weekly hour-long teaching symposiums, such as Responding to Student Contributions in the Classroom. Mentored new graduate students on how to effectively communicate mathematical and statistical concepts to diverse learners.

Collaboration with [Dr. Jennifer Green](https://directory.natsci.msu.edu/Directory/Profiles/Person/102588?org=2&group=152) and [Dr. Liz Arnold](https://mathematics.colostate.edu/person/?id=B1577B723415D27B13D66791298FF26F&sq=t).
